intro: Sertifera colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian sertifera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
